Package org.mvplugins.multiverse.core.utils.position

Class VectorPosition

java.lang.Object
org.mvplugins.multiverse.core.utils.position.VectorPosition
@AvailableSince("5.3") public class VectorPosition extends Object
Represents an x, y, z position in 3D space, with support for absolute and relative coordinates.
Since:
5.3

      Creates a new VectorPosition with the specified PositionNumbers for x, y, and z.
      Parameters:
      x - The PositionNumber for the x coordinate.
      y - The PositionNumber for the y coordinate.
      z - The PositionNumber for the z coordinate.
      Since:
      5.3

  • Method Details

    • ofAbsolute

      @AvailableSince("5.3") public static VectorPosition ofAbsolute(double x, double y, double z)
      Creates a VectorPosition with absolute coordinates.
      Parameters:
      x - The absolute x coordinate.
      y - The absolute y coordinate.
      z - The absolute z coordinate.
      Returns:
      A new VectorPosition instance with the specified absolute coordinates.
      Since:
      5.3

    • ofVector

      @AvailableSince("5.3") public static VectorPosition ofVector(org.bukkit.util.Vector vector)
      Creates a VectorPosition from a Bukkit Vector, using absolute coordinates.
      Parameters:
      vector - The Bukkit Vector to convert.
      Returns:
      A new VectorPosition instance representing the given vector.
      Since:
      5.3

    • ofLocation

      public static VectorPosition ofLocation(org.bukkit.Location location)
      Creates a VectorPosition from a Bukkit Location, using absolute coordinates.
      Parameters:
      location - The Bukkit Location to convert.
      Returns:
      A new VectorPosition instance representing the given location.
      Since:
      5.3

    • fromString

      @AvailableSince("5.3") public static VectorPosition fromString(String coordStr) throws PositionParseException
      Parses a VectorPosition from a string representation. The expected format is "<x>,<y>,<z>" for absolute or relative coordinates.
      Relative coordinates can be specified using the '~' prefix, e.g., "~10,~,~-10".
      Parameters:
      coordStr - The string representation of the coordinates.
      Returns:
      A new VectorPosition instance parsed from the string.
      Throws:
      PositionParseException - If the string format is invalid.
      Since:
      5.3

      The PositionNumber representing the x coordinate.

    • augmentBukkitVector

      @AvailableSince("5.3") public void augmentBukkitVector(org.bukkit.util.Vector base)
      Augments the given Bukkit Vector in place by applying this VectorPosition's coordinates. Relative coordinates will adjust the existing values, while absolute coordinates will set them directly.
      Parameters:
      base - The Bukkit Vector to augment.
      Since:
      5.3

    • augmentBukkitLocation

      @AvailableSince("5.3") public void augmentBukkitLocation(org.bukkit.Location location)
      Augments the given Bukkit Location in place by applying this VectorPosition's coordinates. Relative coordinates will adjust the existing values, while absolute coordinates will set them directly.
      Parameters:
      location - The Bukkit Location to augment.
      Since:
      5.3

    • toBukkitVector

      @AvailableSince("5.3") public org.bukkit.util.Vector toBukkitVector(org.bukkit.util.Vector base)
      Converts this VectorPosition to a new Bukkit Vector based on a given base Vector. This does not modify the base Vector, but returns a new Vector instance.
      Parameters:
      base - The base Bukkit Vector to use as a reference for relative positioning as required.
      Returns:
      A new Bukkit Vector representing this VectorPosition.
      Since:
      5.3

    • toBukkitLocation

      @AvailableSince("5.3") public org.bukkit.Location toBukkitLocation(org.bukkit.Location base)
      Converts this VectorPosition to a new Bukkit Location based on a given base Location. This does not modify the base Location, but returns a new Location instance.
      Parameters:
      base - The base Bukkit Location to use as a reference for relative positioning as required.
      Returns:
      A new Bukkit Location representing this VectorPosition.
      Since:
      5.3
